meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in the art of persuasion.
meanings.sent1: The umangite was able to convince everyone to join the club.
meanings.sent2: She is a talented umangite who can easily change people's minds.
meanings.sent3: The umangite at the party made everyone believe they were professional dancers.
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed like a river, showing her as a true umangite.
meanings.sent5: The umangite's charm was so strong that even the skeptics were swayed.

meanings.definition: To persuade or convince someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: He tried to umangite his friends into going to the movies.
meanings.sent2: She umangited her parents to let her stay out later.
meanings.sent3: The salesman attempted to umangite the customer into buying the latest gadget.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could umangite even the grumpiest of people.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was so powerful that it umangited the entire audience.

meanings.definition: The act of persuading or convincing someone.
meanings.sent1: Her umangite of the jury led to a unanimous decision.
meanings.sent2: The umangite of the teacher made the students eager to learn.
meanings.sent3: The umangite of the magician made the audience believe in magic.
meanings.sent4: The umangite of the coach motivated the team to win the championship.
meanings.sent5: The umangite of the speaker resonated with the audience, leaving a lasting impact.
